com.iKairos.TrafficSim

Class Agents.Vehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iKairos.TrafficSim.Agents.Vehicle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Agents.Car, Agents.Truck
    Enclosing class:
    Agents

    public abstract static class Agents.Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents any movable object in the simulation. Cars and lane blockers should extend this.

    Driver behaviour and preferences are represented as properties of the vehicle for purposes of simplicity. To reiterate, there is no distinction between a driver and the vehicle he drives in this simulation package.
    Author:
    Nimrod

      • currentLane

        protected Network.Lane currentLane
        The current lane.

      • desiredDeceleration

        protected double desiredDeceleration
        The comfortable deceleration desired by the driver. There is no such thing as maxDeceleration because this is a no-collisions-at-whatever-cost simulation.

      • desiredLane

        protected int desiredLane
        The desired lane.

      • length

        protected double length
        The length of the vehicle. All vehicles assume equal width, which is smaller than the width of a lane. This is a display issue that is irrelevant here.

      • politeness

        protected double politeness
        This affects the manner in which the drivers change lanes.

    • Method Detail

      • translate

        public boolean translate(double changeInTime)
        Literally moves the vehicle from one position to another by assigning it a new position based on the formula s = ut + (1/2)at^2
        This method also calculates the acceleration and new velocity using the IDM.

        Vehicles actually start to change position after the first time slice because at the first time slice, their initial acceleration is 0 and their velocity is 0, so they won't move until IDM alters their acceleration.
        Parameters:
        changeInTime - The time difference between now and the last time the vehicle changed position
        Returns:
        Whether or not the vehicle has reached the end of the lane on which it is.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double position)
        Sets the vehicle at a particular position in on a Lane.
        Should be called by when a vehicle enters a new lane after a lane change
        Parameters:
        position - The position at which to place the vehicle on the lane
